body_html:
@apaszke Yeah you're right, the old BatchNorm.cpp isn't here anymore. The remaining duplicate is Conv.cpp which is here. To make things cleaner, I'll rename the Conv to ConvCuDNN using the preprocessor script (amd_build/build_pytorch_amd.py) and keep the original PyTorch file names.

Regarding the CUDA8/CUDA9, I see that makes sense.
body_text:
@apaszke Yeah you're right, the old BatchNorm.cpp isn't here anymore. The remaining duplicate is Conv.cpp which is here. To make things cleaner, I'll rename the Conv to ConvCuDNN using the preprocessor script (amd_build/build_pytorch_amd.py) and keep the original PyTorch file names.
Regarding the CUDA8/CUDA9, I see that makes sense.
body:
@apaszke Yeah you're right, the old BatchNorm.cpp isn't here anymore. The remaining duplicate is Conv.cpp which is [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/tree/master/aten/src/ATen/native/mkldnn/Conv.cpp). To make things cleaner, I'll rename the Conv to ConvCuDNN using the preprocessor script (amd_build/build_pytorch_amd.py) and keep the original PyTorch file names.

Regarding the CUDA8/CUDA9, I see that makes sense.
